dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 4300 : Admiral Lloyd R. Joe Vasey Pacific War Commemorative Display Establishment Act

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To authorize Pacific Historic Parks to establish a commemorative display to honor members of the United States Armed Forces who served in the Pacific Theater of World War II, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Admiral Lloyd R. Joe Vasey Pacific War Commemorative Display Establishment Act.

paragraph.text: The term Association means Pacific Historic Parks, a corporation that is—

subparagraph.text: a cooperating association with the National Park Service;
organized under the laws of the State of Hawaii; and
described in section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and exempt from taxation under section 501(a) of that Code.

paragraph.text: The term Director means the Director of the National Park Service.
The term commemorative display means the Pacific Theater of World War II Commemorative Display authorized to be established under section 4(a).

section.text: The purposes of this Act are to—

paragraph.text: honor the brave members of the United States Armed Forces who fought on behalf of the United States of America in the Pacific Theater during World War II;
provide a place to mourn the more than 150,000 American and allied lives lost in the Pacific Theater during World War II; and
educate the public about United States battles in the Pacific Theater and its role in World War II.

subsection.text: The Association may establish and maintain a commemorative display to honor the members of the United States Armed Forces and Allies who served in the Pacific Theater during World War II.

Federal funds may not be used to design, procure, prepare, install, or maintain the commemorative display, but the Director may accept and expend contributions of non-Federal funds and resources for such purposes.

paragraph.text: The Director may allow the commemorative display to be established at a suitable location at the Pearl Harbor site of the World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument in Honolulu, Hawaii.

The commemorative display may not be established at any location under the jurisdiction of the Director until the Director determines that an assured source of non-Federal funding has been established for the design, procurement, installation, and maintenance of the commemorative display.

subsection.text: The final design of the commemorative display shall be subject to the approval of the Director.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives December 7, 2017.
